title: Cannot Host Multiple Apps with PingAccess for Azure AD?
body:
[Tapez vos commentaires ici]

Hello,

I want to host two applications behind the same PingAccess server. and Microsoft documentation state the following:

Internal URL: Normally you provide the URL that takes you to the app’s sign-in page when you’re on the corporate network. For this scenario, the connector needs to treat the PingAccess proxy as the front page of the application. Use this format: "https://host name of your PingAccess server:port". The port is 3000 by default, but you can configure it in PingAccess.

When hosting two applications behind the same PingAccess instance, the Azure AD Application Proxy connector needs to treat the host name of the PingAccess server as the Internal URL for both applications. However, this does not seem to be possible, as trying to configure the same Internal URL on two applications in Azure AD leads to the error "Internal url entered is already being used by another application".

There must be a way to host multiple applications with Azure AD Application Proxy and PingAccess. How can this be done?
---

title: removing hardcoded Path to Az.Accounts
body:
Regarding Key Encryption Key scenario. In PS Script you should avoird using hardcoded path to Az module but instead use something like : 
``` powershell
# Load ADAL Assemblies. 
$RootlibAzAccount = Join-Path -Path ([System.IO.Path]::GetDirectoryName( (Get-Module Az.accounts).Path)) -ChildPath 'PreloadAssemblies'

$adal = Join-Path -Path $RootlibAzAccount -ChildPath "Microsoft.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.dll" 
$adalforms = Join-Path -Path $RootlibAzAccount -ChildPath "Microsoft.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.Platform.dll"
[System.Reflection.Assembly]::LoadFrom($adal)
[System.Reflection.Assembly]::LoadFrom($adalforms)

```
---

title: The element 'validate-jwt' has invalid child element
body:
Hello, 
` <required-claims>` has to be the last child of `<validate-jwt>`

Sample that does not compile :
```
<validate-jwt` header-name="Authorization" failed-validation-httpcode="401">
            <required-claims>
                <claim name="someclaim" match="all">
                    <value></value>
                </claim>
            </required-claims>
            <issuer-signing-keys>
                <key>eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9</key>
            </issuer-signing-keys>
            <audiences>
                <audience>audience</audience>
            </audiences>
        </validate-jwt>

```
Same sample with` <required-claims>` as last child that compiles: 

```
        <validate-jwt header-name="Authorization" failed-validation-httpcode="401">
            <issuer-signing-keys>
                <key>eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9</key>
            </issuer-signing-keys>
            <audiences>
                <audience>audience</audience>
            </audiences>
            <required-claims>
                <claim name="someclaim" match="all">
                    <value />
                </claim>
            </required-claims>
        </validate-jwt>
```


---

title: Erreur code exemple java pour "Démarrage rapide : Synthétiser la voix vers un fichier audio"
body:
Le code java donné en exemple dans la page "Démarrage rapide : Synthétiser la voix vers un fichier audio" comporte deux erreurs.
1 - Il manque un :
_import com.microsoft.cognitiveservices.speech.audio.*;_

2 - Erreur dans le nom de l'objet audioFileName : 
_System.out.println("Speech synthesized to [" + audioFilename + "] for text [" + text + "]");_
est à remplacer par 
_System.out.println("Speech synthesized to [" + audioFileName + "] for text [" + text + "]");_

title: French verion of this page is incorrect
body:
Please review the French translation of this page :

**EN-US:**
General-purpose v1 accounts: Legacy account type for blobs, files, queues, and tables. Use general-purpose v2 accounts instead when possible.

**French version:**
Comptes v1 universels : Type de compte de stockage hérité pour les objets blob, les fichiers, les files d’attente et les tables. _Utilisez ce type de compte à la place des comptes v2 universels lorsque cela est possible._

Translation should be : anciens comptes type de stockage pour les objets blob, les fichiers, les files d’attente et les tables. Utilisez à la place les compte v2 universels à la place lorsque cela est possible.

**EN-US:**
BlobStorage accounts: Legacy Blob-only storage accounts. Use general-purpose v2 accounts instead when possible.

**French version:**
Comptes BlobStorage : anciens comptes de stockage Blob uniquement. _Utilisez ce type de compte à la place des comptes v2 universels lorsque cela est possible._

Translation should be: 
Comptes BlobStorage : anciens comptes de stockage Blob uniquement. Utilisez à la place les comptes v2 universels lorsque cela est possible.

Best regards

title: Need some guidance preventing major and breaking Windows node updates ?
body:
AKS helps on getting the latest OS security updates and Kubernetes releases, which is perfectlly fine.

But, as Windows containers and host OS has strict compatibility constraints, i'm wondering how AKS would notify of a MAJOR OS update on Windows nodes image?

As there is no hyperv isolation available for Windows Containers in K8s (so nor in AKS), a container image rebuild is the only way to keep application runnig after such updates, and I want to be sure to anticipate such scenario...

I.E I don't wan't any scale-up, cluster upgrade or redeployment operation to "accidentally" broke my app by provisioning nodes on a new major Windows Server version.

Do I have to prevent this with my "own validation process", providing new (private) nodes, and testing my app runs fine on these ?

Does AKS will provide some special warning before any major Windows Server OS version is beeing pushed as default node image ?

La chaîne de caractère que la chaîne saisie conditionne les suggestions de termes
Les suggestions de termes de votre exemple commencent par la même chaîne de caractères que la requête saisie

Ma question : est-ce qu’il est possible que les suggestions de termes aient un début de chaine de caractères différent de de la chaîne de caractère de la requête ?

Exemple :
Requête saisie : économie sociale
Suggestions de termes : entreprise sociale ; social business…

title: Mistake Virtual Machine creation
body:
In VM creation snippet below

storage_image_reference {
        publisher = "Canonical"
        offer     = "UbuntuServer"
        sku       = "16.04.0-LTS"
        version   = "latest"
    }

"Storage" does not exist. It must be "source"

source_image_reference {
        publisher = "Canonical"
        offer     = "UbuntuServer"
        sku       = "16.04.0-LTS"
        version   = "latest"
    }

It correct in the last snippet (the full snippet). Not the first.

title: Wrong acronym in french translation of the kubernetes walkthrough page
body:
Hello, 
I think there is an issue with the french translation of the page https://docs.microsoft.com/fr-fr/azure/aks/kubernetes-walkthrough#create-aks-cluster : the title "Create AKS cluster" is translated in "Créer un cluster ACS". This acronym may refer to Azure Cloud Shell (presented earlier in the page) but the cluster is really AKS, as confirmed by the first sentence bellow (Utilisez la commande az aks create pour créer un cluster AKS). 
The same typo is repeated at the bottom of this page and several others, in the "next steps" section : "Pour en savoir plus sur ACS et parcourir le code complet de l’exemple de déploiement, passez au tutoriel sur le cluster Kubernetes." 
Apart from that the documentation is great, thank you for maintaining it ! 

EDIT : I realized ACS may also refer to Azure Container Service

title: 2 errors while trying this
body:
Hello,

1. Error during the task "Azure DevTest Labs Create VM". I'm using version 3.* (preview) of the task. The error message is :

Error => code: 'InvalidDeploymentParameterValue'; message = 'The value of deployment parameter 'AsPlainText' is null. Please specify the value or use the parameter reference. See https://aka.ms/resource-manager-parameter-files for details.'

So when putting "-newVMName '$(vmName)' -userName '$(userName)' -password (ConvertTo-SecureString -String '$(password)' -AsPlainText -Force)" in the field "template parameters" of the task, AsPlainText is interpreted as a parameter of the template.
I couldn't find a syntax to use it as a parameter of ConvertTo-SecureString.

Yet, I realized that ConvertTo-SecureString is not necessary and that I simply could use -password '$(password)'


2. Error when executing the script GetLabVMParams.ps. I'm using version 4.* of the Azure Powershell task. I left the default output variable for the lab vm Id in the previous step, so passing the Script Argument -labVmId '$(labVMId)' to the powershell task returned this error :

[error]MissingSubscription : The request did not have a subscription or a valid tenant level resource provider.

I then gave the Reference Name "vm" for the output variable in the previous task and then passed the Script Argument -labVmId '$(vm.labVmId)' and it worked.

title: Cannot Host Multiple Apps with PingAccess for Azure AD?
body:
[Tapez vos commentaires ici]

Hello,

I want to host two applications behind the same PingAccess server. and Microsoft documentation state the following:

Internal URL: Normally you provide the URL that takes you to the app’s sign-in page when you’re on the corporate network. For this scenario, the connector needs to treat the PingAccess proxy as the front page of the application. Use this format: "https://host name of your PingAccess server:port". The port is 3000 by default, but you can configure it in PingAccess.

When hosting two applications behind the same PingAccess instance, the Azure AD Application Proxy connector needs to treat the host name of the PingAccess server as the Internal URL for both applications. However, this does not seem to be possible, as trying to configure the same Internal URL on two applications in Azure AD leads to the error "Internal url entered is already being used by another application".

There must be a way to host multiple applications with Azure AD Application Proxy and PingAccess. How can this be done?

title: removing hardcoded Path to Az.Accounts
body:
Regarding Key Encryption Key scenario. In PS Script you should avoird using hardcoded path to Az module but instead use something like : 
``` powershell
# Load ADAL Assemblies. 
$RootlibAzAccount = Join-Path -Path ([System.IO.Path]::GetDirectoryName( (Get-Module Az.accounts).Path)) -ChildPath 'PreloadAssemblies'

$adal = Join-Path -Path $RootlibAzAccount -ChildPath "Microsoft.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.dll" 
$adalforms = Join-Path -Path $RootlibAzAccount -ChildPath "Microsoft.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.Platform.dll"
[System.Reflection.Assembly]::LoadFrom($adal)
[System.Reflection.Assembly]::LoadFrom($adalforms)

```
---

title: The element 'validate-jwt' has invalid child element
body:
Hello, 
` <required-claims>` has to be the last child of `<validate-jwt>`

Sample that does not compile :
```
<validate-jwt` header-name="Authorization" failed-validation-httpcode="401">
            <required-claims>
                <claim name="someclaim" match="all">
                    <value></value>
                </claim>
            </required-claims>
            <issuer-signing-keys>
                <key>eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9</key>
            </issuer-signing-keys>
            <audiences>
                <audience>audience</audience>
            </audiences>
        </validate-jwt>

```
Same sample with` <required-claims>` as last child that compiles: 

```
        <validate-jwt header-name="Authorization" failed-validation-httpcode="401">
            <issuer-signing-keys>
                <key>eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9</key>
            </issuer-signing-keys>
            <audiences>
                <audience>audience</audience>
            </audiences>
            <required-claims>
                <claim name="someclaim" match="all">
                    <value />
                </claim>
            </required-claims>
        </validate-jwt>
```


---

title: French verion of this page is incorrect
body:
Please review the French translation of this page :

**EN-US:**
General-purpose v1 accounts: Legacy account type for blobs, files, queues, and tables. Use general-purpose v2 accounts instead when possible.

**French version:**
Comptes v1 universels : Type de compte de stockage hérité pour les objets blob, les fichiers, les files d’attente et les tables. _Utilisez ce type de compte à la place des comptes v2 universels lorsque cela est possible._

Translation should be : anciens comptes type de stockage pour les objets blob, les fichiers, les files d’attente et les tables. Utilisez à la place les compte v2 universels à la place lorsque cela est possible.

**EN-US:**
BlobStorage accounts: Legacy Blob-only storage accounts. Use general-purpose v2 accounts instead when possible.

**French version:**
Comptes BlobStorage : anciens comptes de stockage Blob uniquement. _Utilisez ce type de compte à la place des comptes v2 universels lorsque cela est possible._

Translation should be: 
Comptes BlobStorage : anciens comptes de stockage Blob uniquement. Utilisez à la place les comptes v2 universels lorsque cela est possible.

Best regards

title: Need some guidance preventing major and breaking Windows node updates ?
body:
AKS helps on getting the latest OS security updates and Kubernetes releases, which is perfectlly fine.

But, as Windows containers and host OS has strict compatibility constraints, i'm wondering how AKS would notify of a MAJOR OS update on Windows nodes image?

As there is no hyperv isolation available for Windows Containers in K8s (so nor in AKS), a container image rebuild is the only way to keep application runnig after such updates, and I want to be sure to anticipate such scenario...

I.E I don't wan't any scale-up, cluster upgrade or redeployment operation to "accidentally" broke my app by provisioning nodes on a new major Windows Server version.

Do I have to prevent this with my "own validation process", providing new (private) nodes, and testing my app runs fine on these ?

Does AKS will provide some special warning before any major Windows Server OS version is beeing pushed as default node image ?

title: Mistake Virtual Machine creation
body:
In VM creation snippet below

storage_image_reference {
        publisher = "Canonical"
        offer     = "UbuntuServer"
        sku       = "16.04.0-LTS"
        version   = "latest"
    }

"Storage" does not exist. It must be "source"

source_image_reference {
        publisher = "Canonical"
        offer     = "UbuntuServer"
        sku       = "16.04.0-LTS"
        version   = "latest"
    }

It correct in the last snippet (the full snippet). Not the first.

title: Wrong acronym in french translation of the kubernetes walkthrough page
body:
Hello, 
I think there is an issue with the french translation of the page https://docs.microsoft.com/fr-fr/azure/aks/kubernetes-walkthrough#create-aks-cluster : the title "Create AKS cluster" is translated in "Créer un cluster ACS". This acronym may refer to Azure Cloud Shell (presented earlier in the page) but the cluster is really AKS, as confirmed by the first sentence bellow (Utilisez la commande az aks create pour créer un cluster AKS). 
The same typo is repeated at the bottom of this page and several others, in the "next steps" section : "Pour en savoir plus sur ACS et parcourir le code complet de l’exemple de déploiement, passez au tutoriel sur le cluster Kubernetes." 
Apart from that the documentation is great, thank you for maintaining it ! 

EDIT : I realized ACS may also refer to Azure Container Service

title: 2 errors while trying this
body:
Hello,

1. Error during the task "Azure DevTest Labs Create VM". I'm using version 3.* (preview) of the task. The error message is :

Error => code: 'InvalidDeploymentParameterValue'; message = 'The value of deployment parameter 'AsPlainText' is null. Please specify the value or use the parameter reference. See https://aka.ms/resource-manager-parameter-files for details.'

So when putting "-newVMName '$(vmName)' -userName '$(userName)' -password (ConvertTo-SecureString -String '$(password)' -AsPlainText -Force)" in the field "template parameters" of the task, AsPlainText is interpreted as a parameter of the template.
I couldn't find a syntax to use it as a parameter of ConvertTo-SecureString.

Yet, I realized that ConvertTo-SecureString is not necessary and that I simply could use -password '$(password)'


2. Error when executing the script GetLabVMParams.ps. I'm using version 4.* of the Azure Powershell task. I left the default output variable for the lab vm Id in the previous step, so passing the Script Argument -labVmId '$(labVMId)' to the powershell task returned this error :

[error]MissingSubscription : The request did not have a subscription or a valid tenant level resource provider.

I then gave the Reference Name "vm" for the output variable in the previous task and then passed the Script Argument -labVmId '$(vm.labVmId)' and it worked.

title: Python 3 - Feel free to use
body:
Hello,
as you probably know Python 2 End of Life has been announced as January 1st 2020.
I did add below a sample code for Python 3.

'''
import json
import requests
import datetime
import hashlib
import hmac
import base64

# Replace with your Workspace ID
customer_id = "xxxxxxxx"

# Replace with your Primary Key
shared_key = "xxxxxxxx"

# The log type is the name of the event that is being submitted
log_type = 'WebMonitorTest'

# An example JSON web monitor object
json_data = [{
    "slot_ID": 12345,
    "ID": "5cdad72f-c848-4df0-8aaa-ffe033e75d57",
    "availability_Value": 100,
    "performance_Value": 6.954,
    "measurement_Name": "last_one_hour",
    "duration": 3600,
    "warning_Threshold": 0,
    "critical_Threshold": 0,
    "IsActive": "true"
},
    {
    "slot_ID": 67890,
    "ID": "b6bee458-fb65-492e-996d-61c4d7fbb942",
    "availability_Value": 100,
    "performance_Value": 3.379,
    "measurement_Name": "last_one_hour",
    "duration": 3600,
    "warning_Threshold": 0,
    "critical_Threshold": 0,
    "IsActive": "false"
}]
body = json.dumps(json_data)

#####################
######Functions######
#####################

# Build the API signature


def build_signature(customer_id, shared_key, date, content_length, method, content_type, resource):
    x_headers = 'x-ms-date:' + date
    string_to_hash = method + "\n" + \
        str(content_length) + "\n" + content_type + \
        "\n" + x_headers + "\n" + resource
    bytes_to_hash = str.encode(string_to_hash, 'utf-8')
    decoded_key = base64.b64decode(shared_key)
    encoded_hash = (base64.b64encode(hmac.new(
        decoded_key, bytes_to_hash, digestmod=hashlib.sha256).digest())).decode()
    authorization = "SharedKey {}:{}".format(customer_id, encoded_hash)
    return authorization

# Build and send a request to the POST API


def post_data(customer_id, shared_key, body, log_type):
    method = 'POST'
    content_type = 'application/json'
    resource = '/api/logs'
    rfc1123date = datetime.datetime.utcnow().strftime('%a, %d %b %Y %H:%M:%S GMT')
    content_length = len(body)
    signature = build_signature(
        customer_id, shared_key, rfc1123date, content_length, method, content_type, resource)
    uri = 'https://' + customer_id + '.ods.opinsights.azure.com' + \
        resource + '?api-version=2016-04-01'

    headers = {
        'content-type': content_type,
        'Authorization': signature,
        'Log-Type': log_type,
        'x-ms-date': rfc1123date
    }

    response = requests.post(uri, data=body, headers=headers)
    if (response.status_code >= 200 and response.status_code <= 299):
        print('Accepted')
    else:
        print("Response code: {}".format(response.status_code))


post_data(customer_id, shared_key, body, log_type)

'''

James

title: HybridWorker Group created by this script
body:
Hello all.

you should precise that the Hyrid Worker group is created by the script New-OnPremiseHybridWorker.ps1.
As it is a mandatory field, and there is nowhere it is explain that the Hybrid worker group is created when installing the Hybrid Worker, it makes confusion on the field.

I mean, the following section :

"When the agent has successfully connected to Azure Monitor logs, it's listed on the Connected Sources tab of the log analytics Settings page. You can verify that the agent has correctly downloaded the Automation solution when it has a folder called AzureAutomationFiles in C:\Program Files\Microsoft Monitoring Agent\Agent. To confirm the version of the Hybrid Runbook Worker, you can browse to C:\Program Files\Microsoft Monitoring Agent\Agent\AzureAutomation\ and note the \version subfolder."
 
has to be updated as the subfolder "AzureAutomationFiles" is only installed after the "New-OnPremiseHybridWorker.ps1" script has been ran on the On Premise machine.

Thank you.

title: PB PDO PHP
body:
$options = array(
    PDO::MYSQL_ATTR_SSL_CA => '/var/www/html/BaltimoreCyberTrustRoot.crt.pem'
);
$db = new PDO('mysql:host=mydemoserver.mysql.database.azure.com;port=3306;dbname=databasename', 'username@mydemoserver', 'yourpassword', $options);

==> ça n'a pas marché pour moi

Par contre : 

$options = array(
    PDO::MYSQL_ATTR_INIT_COMMAND => 'SET NAMES utf8',
    PDO::MYSQL_ATTR_SSL_CA => '/var/www/html/BaltimoreCyberTrustRoot.crt.pem',
    PDO::MYSQL_ATTR_SSL_VERIFY_SERVER_CERT => false,
);
$db = new PDO('mysql:host=mydemoserver.mysql.database.azure.com;port=3306;dbname=databasename', 'username@mydemoserver', 'yourpassword', $options);

==> là ça marche

Mes sources : https://www.saotn.org/how-to-use-ssl-in-php-data-objects-pdo-mysql/

|Windows 8|Oui\*|S.O.|Oui|Oui\*\*\*|S.O.
|Windows 7|Oui\*|S.O.|Oui|Oui\*\*\*|S.O.

title: Classification multi classes et label
body:
Bonjour, je me pose des questions pour la classification multi classes et plus particulièrement sur l'étiquetage des labels.
Si on choisit X = 15 la période précédant l'arrivée d'une défaillance pour un cas de figure binaire où l'erreur arrive au bout de 50 cycles, alors les cycles 36 à 50 auront le label défaillance, ça j'ai bien compris.
Cependant dans le cas multiclasses je me pose quelques questions. Par exemple, prenons une défaillance de type 1 au bout de 50 cycles, et une défaillance de type 2 au bout de 55 cycles, qui seront donc toutes les deux labelisées 1 et 2.
Comment procède-on ? En effet on est dans une situation où au cycle 45, une défaillance de type 1 arrivera dans les 15 prochains cycles, néanmoins c'est également le cas pour la défaillance de type 2.
Quelle étiquette appliquer, étiquette 1 ou étiquette 2 ?

Merci d'avance !

title: Customers wish to use their corporate Office 365 account how can we configure this?
body:
Hi,
I see this restriction:
"SSO to customer owned apps within the Azure AD B2C tenants is supported. SSO to Office 365 or to other Microsoft and non-Microsoft SaaS apps is not supported."
The feedback we have indicates our customer would prefer to use their corporate O365 (whe they have one) account instead of creating yet another account/password local to our application. Is there a workaround for that?
Thanks,
ErC.

title: Error in translation
body:
Hi and sorry for my Funny English.
I see an error in translation for this document.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/load-balancer/quickstart-create-basic-load-balancer-portal
In English
Create a load balancer rule
A load balancer rule defines how traffic is distributed to the VMs. The rule defines the front-end IP configuration for incoming traffic, the back-end IP pool to receive the traffic, and the required source and destination ports. 

In French, 
https://docs.microsoft.com/fr-fr/azure/load-balancer/quickstart-create-basic-load-balancer-portal
Créer une règle d’équilibreur de charge
Une règle d’équilibreur de charge définit la distribution du trafic vers les machines virtuelles. La règle définit la configuration IP front-end pour le trafic entrant, le pool d’adresses IP front-end pour recevoir le trafic ainsi que les ports source et de destination nécessaires.

The error is "le pool d’adresses IP front-end pour recevoir le trafic" (Is not Front, but back-end).
The good translation is => "le pool d’adresses IP BACK-END pour recevoir le trafic" (the back-end IP pool to receive the traffic).

Regards

Usage:
   bcp --list [options] module-list

   bcp --report [options] module-list html-file
   bcp [options] module-list output-path

Options:
   --boost=path     sets the location of the boost tree to path
   --scan           treat the module list as a list of (possibly non-boost)
                    files to scan for boost dependencies
   --svn            only copy files under cvs version control
   --unix-lines     make sure that all copied files use Unix style line endings
   --namespace=name rename the boost namespace to name (also changes library names).
   --namespace-alias Makes namespace boost an alias of the namespace set with --namespace.

module-list:         a list of boost files or library names to copy
html-file:           the name of a html file to which the report will be written
output-path:         the path to which files will be copied

body:
From a quick look, it seems that your functions can return an int and an error in case something went wrong.

Why not just return the error and let the main function panic? That would be clearer for the reader

body:
Hi,

I followed this tutorial step by step but find myself blocked when trying to build the IoT Edge Solution.
The login works fine, I didn't change anything on the second step as my Edge Device is a virtual machine running on Ubuntu 16.04 64bit
I added the username and the password of my container in the .env file, then the module twin in the deployment manifest, even saved the file.

Then I clicked on "Build the IoT Edge Solution" as indicated, but the command generated didn't work.
At first it was because of the permissions so I added sudo before both docker instructions of the command.
The docker build seems to work but the docker push makes an error :

The push refers to repository [docker.io/library/<my container>.azurecr.io]

title: Traduction incorrecte
body:
Bonjour,

Pour cet article: https://github.com/Microsoft/azure-docs.fr-fr/blob/master/articles/monitoring-and-diagnostics/monitoring-supported-metrics.md

La traduction est incorrecte. La première colonne "Mesure" est une colonne technique, dans le nom doit être utilisé dans les appels HTTP pour Azure. Elle ne doit **pas** être traduite. Cela semble évident pour Batch avec des noms tel que `TotalNodeCount`, moins pour Compute car les noms techniques sont traduisibles, mais c'est le cas dans toutes les situations.

(Je travaille à MS Redmond dans l'équipe Azure SDK, mais je suis français alors j'en profite pour relire les docs traduites :))
